page.title: 12TURNERS HILL PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: {Worth Parish Council}includes the villages of{Copthorne, Crawley Down } and{Turners Hill.}In the last ten years{Copthorne}and{Crawley Down}have grown{large}compared to{Turners Hill} which is still{small.}The{Turners Hill {Society}was set up in{1979}to look after the interests of the{environment in Turners Hill. The{Society}and{Mid {Sussex District Council}set up}a conservation area from{Rayces}to{New {Cottages}and from the{School}to just past{Mantlemas Cottages.}The{Society} started to ask for a{separate Parish {Council}in{1982.}There was a{Public {meeting}that year and a{poll}was carried out in{1983.}Finally it was{ {agreed}by the{Minister of State}that a {new Parish Council}should be set up. The{first elections}will be in{1986.} There may be{seven members}of this new Parish Council.
